Description: Fragment of Corinthian black-figured pottery pyxis lid with part of flange remaining: interior reserved; exterior: from centre, tongue frieze around lost knob; pair of narrow black bands; black-figure decoration consisting of bull to left (stomach, back, hind leg with added red on haunch remaining); blob rosettes as filling ornament; three narrow black bands at edge of rim.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Brussels III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Belgique (p. 2, pl. 2, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.305) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Purchased in Cairo by M. Jean de Mot
